Legal_Issue: Failure to consider subsection 108(4) of IRPA
Application_Facts: FARC threats and violence against Ms. Villegas' family, including the deaths of her brothers
Decision_Outcome: Board's decision quashed and remitted for reconsideration
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Court_Ruling: The Board erred in credibility assessment and failed to apply subsection 108(4) of IRPA
Grounds_for_Claim: Persecution by FARC based on family association
Legal_Standard: Consideration of compelling reasons under subsection 108(4)
Applicable_Legislation: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), subsection 108(4)
Credibility_Assessment: Board unreasonably required conclusive evidence of FARC involvement
Evidence_Assessed: Lack of conclusive proof of FARC involvement
Governing_Rule: Refugee Protection Division must reasonably assess credibility and consider compelling reasons under subsection 108(4) if past persecution is evident
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Requirement for conclusive evidence where not legally mandated
Outcome: Decision quashed and remitted to a different panel
Harm_Assessment: Risk of persecution due to family association with targeted individuals
Cause_Description: Ms. Villegas claimed refugee status due to FARC threats and violence against her family
Evidence_Handling: Insufficient consideration of circumstantial evidence linking FARC to brothers' deaths
Evidence_Issues: Overemphasis on lack of direct evidence
Failure to infer FARC responsibility from context
Evidence_Assessment: Board did not reasonably assess available evidence
Decision_Rationale: Errors in credibility analysis and failure to apply legal provision for compelling cases of past persecution
Evidentiary_Issues: Demand for conclusive evidence inappropriate in refugee context
